titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Maritime History Collection PR 100
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kelly McAnnaney; finding aid updated and expanded by Eva Gretta, 2015

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-03-01T15:07-0500

did.abstract: This collection is comprised of prints and photographs dealing with naval and maritime subjects, including naval engagements and portraits of ships and naval officers, most notably Captain James Lawrence and John Paul Jones.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The materials have been arranged by size into four series. Within each series, materials are arranged by subject.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Maritime History Collection contains material collected from several sources. The bulk of the collection was a gift of The Naval History Society, John S. Barnes Foundation, 1925. Additional material arrived from Eugene H. Pool II, in a series of donations from 1941 to 1944. The remaining pieces were added to the collection by past staff members, when the subject matter related to maritime history.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Maritime History File spans the period from ca. 1700 – ca. 1960 and primarily contains prints and photographs relating to both naval and civilian maritime history. Not strictly a visual image collection, there are newspaper clippings, correspondence and various ephemera that add to the collection’s research value. The collection is divided into four series by size: Boxed Files holds material smaller than 9 x 14 inches; Medium Format Flat Files holds items between 9 x 14 and 24 x 40 inches; Large Format Flat Files holds material between 24 x 40 and 30 x 40 inches; and Oversize Format Flat Files holds material larger than 30 x 40 inches.
More detailed information about the contents is provided in the Scope and Contents notes for individual series and folders.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The importance of New York as a port city is reflected in the large selection of naval and maritime prints found in this collection. Hundreds of prints from the Naval History Society’s John S. Barnes Memorial Library portray naval engagements, and also include portraits of ships and naval officers. The Eugene H. Pool collection contributed nearly 50 images related to Captain James Lawrence, and a large number of prints relate to John Paul Jones. Images of non-naval vessels include many portraits of individual trans-oceanic, coastal, and inland steamboats, yachts, and harbor craft.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series I. Boxed Files is comprised of material that is smaller than 9 x 14 inches and is housed in document boxes. Images are arranged by subject, with ships organized by type, then, when needed ordered alphabetically by name of person or ship. Files contain photographs, including carte-de-visites, cyanotypes, cabinet cards, prints, postcards, newspaper and magazine clipppings, reproductions of paintings and original drawings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sailing Vessels contains images of civilian ships that are powered only by wind, including clipper ships, cutters, Chinese junks, packet ships, schooners, and yachts. The images are arranged alphabetically by each vessel's name. Unidentified ships are sorted by medium and located after identified ships. Images of replicas of historically significant ships can be found in this group, including photographs of the Viking ship Lief Erikson, images of the Half Moon, built for the Hudson-Fulton Celebration in 1909 and photographs, including cyanotypes, of the Santa Maria, created for the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of the Bluenose, Adelia T. Carleton, the Bark Aloha, the pilot boat America, the yacht America, the brig Aspasia, Aurora, the Red star packet Birmingham, USS Brandywine, the clipper ship Challenge, Charlemagne, the old whaler Charles W. Morgan, the revenue cutter Chase, the City of Mobile, the Columbia, Courier, the clipper bark Grapeshot and Cutty Sark.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of the Dauntless, David Crockett, Defender, the sloop Dewitt Clinton, Dove, Edward Sewall, Fidelia, The Flying Cloud, the schooner Frank Atwood, Galatea, General Armstrong, G.W. Rosevelt, the clipper ship Glory of the Sea, the sloop Gjoa, S.S. Golden Gate and the clipper ship M.P. Grace.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of the Havre, the packet ship Hercules, packet ship Isaac Webb, James Baines, Joseph Conrad, Joshua Bates, Flying Cloud, King Philip, Keying, La Duchesse D’Orleans, the bark Lagoda, Leif Erikson, Liberdade, Liverpool, E.R. Stirling, Barquentine Madalan, Barque Magdalene Vinnen, cutter yacht Maria, Mary Celeste, clipper barque Mermaid, Mirth, USS Monongahela and Moses Kimball.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of the clipper ship Nightingale, Niobe, Northern Light, Old Jersey, the clipper ship Oriental, Palma, Pamir, the schooner Brina P. Pendleton, Queen Mab, the clipper ship Racer, the clipper ship Rainbow, the clipper ship Red Jacket, Reliance and the clipper ship R.L. Lane.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes images of the brig Samaritano, the packet ship Samuel Lawrence, Sappho, the schooner Sinaloa, Sovereign of the Seas, Stag Hound, Thingvalla, Timandra, Tusitala, Ulysses, Valkyrie III, the schooner yacht Valor, Vamarie, the passenger clipper Waimate, the red star packet William Byrnes, the clipper ship Young America and the clipper bark Zephyr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Steamships is copmrised of steam powered vesssels as well as those powered by the combination of steam and sail. Ships include paddle steamers, mail steamers, Coast Guard cutters, freighters and ocean liners. Many Hudson River steamboats are represented in this sub series. Images show ships in harbor and at sea and include several images of fires, shipwrecks and other accidents. There are a number of photographs of steamship interiors, including the interiors of ocean liners Caledonia, Conte Di Savoia, Leviathan, Kroonland and Manhattan and steamboats Robert Fulton and Washington Irving. IMages are arranged alphabetically by ship name with unidentified ships filed at the end of the subseries.

did.unittitle: Steamships, A-Z and Unidentified (small format photographs)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Naval Ships & Equipment contains images of a variety of naval vessels including battleships, cruisers, destryoers, frigates, monitors, navy hospital ships, torpedo boats, and so on. United States naval ships comprise the majority of these images, but a group of foreign naval vessels can be found at the end of the subseries. The USS Maine, both before and after its destruction, and the USS Constitution are well represented. Photographs of the United States Pacific Fleet traveling through the Panama Canal in 1919 are filed under individual ship name as well as under "Numbered Destroyers." Images by photographers J.S. Johnston and the Pach Brothers (USS Brooklyn, USS New York, USS Oregon, USS Texas) are found throughout this subseries.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Boxes 16 & 17- Columbian Naval Review

did.unittitle: Subseries I.4: Other Ships & Ship Details

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Other Ships & Ship Details includes images of barges, motor ships, lightships, rowboats and tugboats. Photographs of the Swedish American liners MS Gripsholm and MS Kungsholm include interior views. Images on board unidentified ships include both naval and civilian ships, on deck and below. Ship plans are reproductions, several for ferryboats, including the Artic, Easton and J.M. Waterbury. Reproductions of Robert Fulton plans show various steamboat improvements. Relics contain mainly photographs, including an image of the stairs from the steamer Henry Clay, several decorative carvings removed from steamships and a clipping showing boatswain's calls. One interesting relic is a label from a crate salvaged from the wreck of the steamship Atlantic in 1873. Images of sailmaking include a photograph of a New Jersey sail and rigging loft and a clipping of a sailmaker's bench, showing the tools of the trade.

did.unittitle: Ferries & Lighters- New Jersey Central Railroad

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Views is comprised of images of both United States and foreign locations. Miscellaneous views are varied, from a souvenir set of images of New York City to a group of postcards showing inventor John Ericsson's home in Langbanshyttan, Sweden.

did.unittitle: Photographs of New York Harbor, taken by J.G.M. Glessner 1892

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Naval Battles is comprised of images of varioyus wars and battles at sea. The bulk of this material surrounds battles during the War of 1812.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also Box 16, Columbian Naval Review

did.unittitle: Series II. Medium Format Flat Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series II contains material between the sizes of 9 by 14 and 20 by 24 inches. Much of this series comes from clipping from illustrated newspapers and naval periodicals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file includes the Currier and Ives lithographs The Gem of the Pacific and The Celebrated Ship Dreadnought as well as Nathaniel Currier’s The Celebrated Clipper Bark Grapeshot Belonging to Geo. Law Esq. N.Y.. This file also contains the aquatint The Brig Jane and Cutter Beaufoy on 20 February 1823.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs, clippings from periodicals and original lithographs such as Currier and Ives The Miniature Ship “Red, White, and Blue”, Clipper Ship Three Brothers and Nathaniel Currier’s Pilot Boat Wm. J. Romer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs, clippings from periodicals and original prints including Various Boats, Barks &c. used in the Rivers and on the Coasts of Peru in South America, engraved for Middleton’s Complete System of Geography. This file also contains several chromolithographs after works by Frederic S. Cozzens.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs, clippings from periodicals and original lithographs, including William Endicott’s Atlantic’s Return and Nathaniel Currier’s U.S.M. Steam Ship Arctic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs, clippings from periodicals and original lithographs, including Currier and Ives’ The Narragansett Steamship Co’s Steamer Bristol of the Fall River Line, Nathaniel Currier’s U.S.M. Steam Ship Baltic, C. Bigot’s The British Queen and Senefelder’s Benjamin Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs, advertisements for the American Steamship Circassian, images of the steamship Clermont and J.H. Bufford’s lithograph Camel Steam Tug, Lieut. J.A. Winslow, U.S.N. Inventor. Also includes photograph of Anchor Line Steamship “City of Rome” (used to transport Spanish prisoners of war in 1898) signed by the ship’s passengers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs of the U.S.S. Alliance, U.S.S. America, U.S.S. Amphitrite, U.S.S. Annapolis and U.S.S. Arionza.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs of the U.S.S. Brooklyn, U.S.S. Boston, U.S.S. Cruiser Birmingham, U.S.S. Cruiser Baltimore, and a print of the U.S.S. Bonhome Richard.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains clippings from periodicals, photographs and Nathaniel Currier's lithograph U.S. Frigate Cumberland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs and the lithograph Launch of the Steam Frigate Fulton the First, at New York 29th, Octr. 1814.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains clippings from periodicals and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs, clippings from periodicals and prints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs and clippings from periodicals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains several prints picturing naval engagements and events from the Barbary war, including an engraving of The Blowing Up of the Fire Ship Intrepid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains several prints picturing naval engagements from the War of 1812, including lithographs by Samuel Walters and an engraving of the Peacock and L'Epervier after Thomas Birch.

scopecontent.p: This file contains clippings from periodicals, prints and photographs picturing the U.S.S. Maine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains images of the steamer "Keokuk", U.S. Monitor "Weehawken, U.S. Steam Sloop "Iroquois", U.S. Steam Frigate Roanoke, U.S. Iron Clad Ram "Dictator", U.S. Iron Clad Screw Ram "Dunderberg" and U.S. Iron Clad Steamer "New Ironsides".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains images of the New York, Marblehead, Boston and Bennington.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs and lithographs, including Currier & Ives print New York Ferry Boat.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs and prints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains a plan of the U.S.S. Monitor, the Barque California , the Clermont, U.S. Frigate Chesapeake and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains plans of dredge boats, including the U.S. Dredge Boat Essayons.

did.unittitle: Plans & Drawings - Yachts - by Saunders & West Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains original plans for yachts designed by Saunders & West Co., including Mr. Starbuck's steam yacht Tillie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs, including a photo of the launching of the U.S. Battleship California at Brooklyn Naval Yard on April 28, 1904.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains various newspaper clippings, including a 1921 article from the Boston Evening Transcript that details the history and collections of the Naval History Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains ephemera, including advertisements for steamships and prints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains battle scenes of the War of 1812, including Macdonough's Victory on Lake Champlain , Capture of H.B.M. Sloop of War Frolic by the U.S> Sloop of War Wasp, engravings after battle scenes painted by Thomas Birch and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file is not accesible due to condition issues. It contains This Representation of the U.S. Frigate Constitution, Isaac Hull, Esq. Commander, Capturing His Britannic Majesty's Frigate Guerriere, James R. Dacres,Esq.Commander, an engraving after a painting by Thomas Birch. Another copy of this engraving can be found in flat file 116, War of 1812- Miscellaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file is not accessible due to condition issues. It contains United States and Macedonian , an engraving after a painting by Thomas Birch. Another copy of this engraving can be found in flat file 116, War of 1812- Miscellaneous.

did.unittitle: War of 1812- Battle of Lake Erie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: his file contains the engravings Perry's Victory on Lake Erie, after J.J. Barralet, Perry's Victory on Lake Erie, after Thomas Birch and others.

did.unittitle: War of 1812- Battle of Lake Erie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains the engravings Perry's Victory on Lake Erie, after J.J. Barralet, Perry's Victory on Lake Erie, after Thomas Birch and This representation of the Battle on Lake Erie is respectfully inscribed to Commodore Perry his Officers and gallant Crews By their humble servant, James Webster.

did.unittitle: War of 1812- Battle of Lake Erie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file is not accessible due to condition issues. It contains the print This representation of the Battle on Lake Erie is respectfully inscribed to Commodore Perry his Officers and gallant Crews By their humble servant, James Webster. Another copy of this print can be found in FF 118.

did.unittitle: War of 1812- USS Chesapeake & HMS Shannon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains several prints of the Battle of the USS Chesapeake and HMS Shannon, including a set of lithographs published by Smith, Elder & Co with an accompanying key.

did.unittitle: War of 1812- USS Constitution & the Java

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains prints of the battle between the USS Constitution and HMS Java, including a set of four engravings after paintings by Nicholas Pocock.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains prints picturing various naval battles of the Civl War, including the bombardment of forts Hatteras and Clark and others.

did.unittitle: Civil War- Battle between the Monitor & the Merrimac

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains prints picturing the battle between the Monitor and Merrimac.

did.unittitle: Civil War- Battle between the Monitor & the Merrimac

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file is not accessible due to condition issue. It contains the lithograph Desperate Encounter Between the Ericsson Battery "Monitor" 2 Guns, And The "Merrimac", 12 Guns.

did.unittitle: Civil War- Battle of Port Royal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains prints picturing the Battle of Port Royal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains prints picturing naval battles of the Spanish American War, including Bombardment of Matanzas.

did.unittitle: Spanish American War- Destruction of the USS Maine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains prints picturing the destruction of the USS Maine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains prints picturing miscellaneous naval battles from the eighteenth through the early twentieth centuries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains prints picturing British naval expeditions, including images of the Battle of Havana (1782) and the Napoleonic Wars.

did.unittitle: Naval Reception for Li Hung Chang

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs of the naval reception for the Chinese diplomat Li Hung Chang in New York harbor on August 28, 1896.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs and prints of various races, including Currier & Ives lithograph Vigilant and Valkyrie in a "Thrash to Windward".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains newspaper clippings and prints of various naval personalities, including Commodore John Paul Jones, Rear-Admiral D.G. Farragut and Admiral George Dewey among others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series IV, Oversize Flat Files, includes material larger than 30 x 40 inches. Material is arranged by ship type. The majority of images in this series depict steamboats.

did.unittitle: White Star Line (includes Oceana, Queen Elizabeth and Queen Mary)
USS Chesepeke, USS Constitution, Ironclad Keokuk
